question: It is true that biodiversity includes plants, animals, microorganisms, and ecosystems.
It is false that biodiversity only refers to the variety of animal species on Earth.
It is true that habitat destruction is the most significant threat to biodiversity.
It is false that pollution has no effect on biodiversity.
It is true that climate change affects ecosystems and species' survival.
It is false that global warming has no impact on coral reefs.
It is true that overexploitation of resources like excessive hunting and fishing can lead to species decline.
It is false that deforestation only affects animals and has no impact on global warming.
It is true that invasive species can disrupt ecosystems by outcompeting native species.
It is false that industrial and agricultural expansion has no effect on biodiversity.
It is true that biodiversity hotspots contain a high number of endemic species.
It is false that a region must have only 500 endemic plant species to qualify as a biodiversity hotspot.
It is true that at least 70% of a region's original natural vegetation must be lost for it to be considered a biodiversity hotspot.
It is false that there are only 10 biodiversity hotspots in the world.
It is true that the Amazon Rainforest is the world's largest tropical rainforest.
It is false that the Congo Basin is located in South America.
It is true that the Sundaland biodiversity hotspot includes Indonesia and Malaysia.
It is false that Madagascar is not a biodiversity hotspot.
It is true that India has four major biodiversity hotspots.
It is false that the Himalayas are not a biodiversity hotspot in India.
It is true that the Indo-Burma region includes northeastern India.
It is false that the Western Ghats are located in northern India.
It is true that the Sundaland biodiversity hotspot includes the Nicobar Islands.
It is false that biodiversity does not help in climate regulation.
It is true that deforestation can be reduced by planting more trees.
It is false that plastic pollution has no effect on marine life.
It is true that overfishing reduces fish populations and disrupts marine food chains.
It is false that conservation laws are unnecessary for protecting endangered species.
It is true that sustainable farming can help protect biodiversity.
It is false that biodiversity loss does not impact human life.
It is true that coral bleaching occurs due to warmer ocean temperatures.
It is false that industrial pollution only affects humans and not biodiversity.
It is true that raising awareness is an important step in protecting biodiversity.
